column3: str
You will accompany us, then? My thanks!
Our task is simple─we shall take Blitzen on a tour of Gridania and delight the children we meet with his marvelous illusions.
While little helpers will be distributing presents of a more tangible nature, I believe that Blitzen's glamour will perfectly set the tone for such gift-giving.
Being a visitor to this city, however, I am not certain where to seek out children. May I trust you to guide us to them?
Marvelous! Without further ado, then, where shall we head first?
What will you say?
The Greatloam Growery.
The Leatherworkers' Guild.
The markets.
The Whistling Miller.
Apkallu Falls.
Never mind.
Very well. Let us go and spread some Starlight cheer!
Wow, a real reindeer! I've only ever read about them before!
Go on, Blitzen! Show us your spectacular glamour!
Aaah! Amazing!
Indeed─much like the scent of freshly hewn cedar! Happy Starlight, youngling. We, the saint's little helpers, have come bearing gifts one can touch as well as see.
We hope you like it!
Hunks of wood...?
It is a lumber set, child. Comprised of the finest selection of timber the forest has to share. You have your soft-grained maple, some supple ash, a stern oak... Cannot you hear the symphony?
Er... No, not really...
Those are building blocks, my dear. Made especially for you by the Carpenters' Guild!
Oh! I love blocks! Thank you, little helpers!
Curious that he should appreciate “blocks” over fine cross-sections of lumber. Puzzling indeed...
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! What a pleasant surprise.
Why, hello, adventurer! Are you this reindeer's friend?
As you can see, the Botanists' and Carpenters' Guilds are working together for this year's celebration, with the guildmasters volunteering to be little helpers.
Our gifts are a joint effort─Beatin's people at the Carpenters' Guild made some beautiful blocks out of the wood my botanists gathered while tending the forest.
I hope these toys sow the seeds of inspiration within the hearts of our younglings, that they might grow up embracing nature. But enough of my vegetation metaphors─we have presents to distribute!
Come, Timbermaster! More children await.
Indeed. And let us use that “blocks” jest from earlier─it seemed rather effective...
Oh, hello! This is my first time meeting a reindeer─is he friendly?
Go on, Blitzen! Show us your spectacular glamour!
Wow! It's beautiful!
Happy Starlight, my dear. I have a gift for you from the saint. Perhaps not as sensational as that reindeer's trick, but these will last longer.
<gasp> Leather accessories! I love them! Thank you so much, little helper!
Hmph. Darling little thing.
...I trust you are fulfilling your Starlight duties with the diligence expected of you?
Another Starlight volunteer, I take it?
I too have volunteered my services this year. I thought it only right, seeing how much my own little ones delight in the season.
'Tis remarkable how a child's smile can warm the heart. An infectious joy if there ever was one.
Anyway, I must be off. Enjoy the rest of the festivities.
Wow! Reindeer are massive! Look at him! He's massive!
Go on, Blitzen! Show us your spectacular glamour!
Uwaaah! That's incredible!
(-???-)Happy Starlight, my child! This little helper has arrived with a very special gift.
Cookies!? My favorite! Thank you, little helper! I'm going to go and share them with my friends!

Well, if it isn't <Switch(PlayerParameter(70))><Case(1)><Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight></Case><Case(2)><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></Case><Case(3)><Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight></Case></Switch>! Lending your assistance to the Starlight Celebration?
As you can see, the Carline Canopy is also participating in the festivities this year.
Our establishment has adopted the Starlight spirit, with a special children's menu in addition to festive decorations. 'Tis the season, after all!
Now, while I would love to stay and chat, I must be off─these cookies won't deliver themselves! I look forward to seeing you again at the Canopy.

Why, good <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If>, Mister Reindeer! You have quite an adorable face and snuffly nose at that!
Go on, Blitzen! Show us your spectacular glamour!
What a marvelous spectacle! You're truly amazing, Mister Reindeer!
(-???-)Forgive me for interrupting your delight, sweet child, but this little helper comes bearing a gift from the north.
An Ishgardian coat? Oh, how lovely and warm! I shall treasure it, little helper! Thank you with all my heart!
What a pleasant surprise to meet you here, my friend. You are lending your capable hand to the observances, I take it?
As a citizen of Starlight's birthplace, I felt compelled to volunteer my services in some way, however small. And thus I seem to have become a little helper.
While 'twas an audience with the Elder Seedseer that called me here initially, I am glad for the opportunity to bear witness to the bright smiles of Gridania's children.
Yes, I have always been quite fond of this season myself. Though I must confess that as colors go, I am somewhat partial to blue...
...Hm? Why is it that I feel we have spoken of this before? Curious...
Ah, but I mustn't dally─many gifts still want for delivery. Till we meet again!
I had no idea reindeer were so big...
Go on, Blitzen! Show us your spectacular glamour!
Oh my... It's so sparkly...
Starlight greetings, you adorable little moppet! I am one of the saint's little helpers, and I have a <Emphasis>real</Emphasis> sparkling present for you! Here you go!
A lovely doll...with such pretty eyes. Thank you, little helper.
(-???-)Hah, is that what passes as a gift for you lace-wearers!?
Ruffian! What are <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> doing here!?
Deliverin' <Emphasis>proper</Emphasis> presents, what else? Here's yours, little one. Enjoy it, now!
A little frypan...with such adorable forks and spoons. Thank you, little helper.
Heh! See? A present that represents the glory and traditions of Limsa Lominsa's peerless culinary history! More thoughtful by far than some half-baked doll from some half-baked noble!
Take that back!
Make me!
I will not stoop to your level!
I'll enjoy playing house with the lovely doll and adorable silverware. Thank you, little helpers!
...Well, that's a happy Starlight, then.
...Quite.
Well, that went splendidly, wouldn't you say? The little helpers appearing when they did only added to the children's enjoyment. And last but not least, Blitzen played his part to perfection.
We shall take a well-earned rest, but we would welcome your assistance again should you feel like going on another tour.
